newsitem.title: HUNGARY: HUNGARY NOON RADIO HEADLINES - DEC 27.
newsitem.headline: HUNGARY NOON RADIO HEADLINES - DEC 27.

text.p: These are the main headlines on Hungary's Kossuth Radio midday news. Reuters cannot vouch for their accuracy:
- Visiting Romanian foreign minister Adrian Severin said that in the future relations with Hungary will be the most important.
- The SFOR Hungarian unit in Bosnia will have new tasks next year, the army said.
- Independent police trade unions are planning nationwide protests against falling living standards.

- The extreme cold is causing train delays of at least one hour. Main roads are clear but minor roads are still blocked by snow with many villages cut off. Temperatures could fall to as low as -20 degrees Celsius.
